UnitType.Backstory: Thorus was mighty even as a young man, winning most wrestling matches against the other warrior hopefuls. His mother then sent him alone into the wild, to prove himself, and now all tell the tales of the massive wolf he slew alone. Despite his budding ability as a channeler, Thorus values might and battle tactics highest. No wizard earns the respect he has for men well-formed into an unstoppable phalanx.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You were only eleven when you were sent into the wilds by your mother, with only a spear. You returned in the only manner possible: clutching the blood-matted fur of the alpha wolf that had hunted you.
From that day forward, no one doubted that you were a warrior, chosen by the ancient Gods.
You know that Channelers now gather might under them. You know that your people distrust that magic, the power you, too, have learned to wield. But your people doubt magic because they are wise and great - strength of arms is the advantage that shall bring Aygethos to rule the coming new era. By victory in battle, magic shall take its proper place in this world now free of Titans - a tool, no mightier than shields and spears.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Few among the Serionne feel comfortable speaking to Geneveye - some whisper she is mad, and when not in battle, she speaks incomprehensible utterances, and has even killed men who tried to become her lovers. What is known to be true is that she is a leader of almost supernatural skill and effectiveness in battle. She is said to enter a kind of trance, that makes her lucid and effective in ordering men to win near-hopeless battles.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You were still a child, when the first visions came. You saw an old country, united in faith, and strong in arms. You could hear their prayers, strong - and then silenced. The prayers were that of the Serionne, beautiful and pure in faith.
At first, you were afraid to speak of these visions, which did not come in dreams, but to your waking eyes. As you became a woman, the world was harsh and cruel but the visions only grew stronger. Mad, cursed they called you.
But then it was you, with those prayers upon your lips, holding a sword aloft and leading the men when they were afraid. When battle came, the visions became real, and you became a Serionne knight. Wolves, bandits, trolls - you led to the men to fight off those terrors. Now, they do not call you cursed, but blessed.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Myrthani is a private leader, rarely cruel but insistent upon enforcing laws. The death of her father, some say, left her a melancholy temperament. Her rule, however, does not seem weighed down by any torment. She refuses to take any husband, and will give no plan of succession. But some insist that she regularly takes on new male lovers, and has many children hidden about the country, who she sees and mentors in turn.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Isoth is where the Nothari live now. It was not always so.
Your father led the Nothari, before Isoth was born. In the time just after cataclysm, they were driven from cold havens by rains of fire and splitting earth. There your people were burned and eaten by an ashwake dragon, dwindling the tribe quickly.
None could stand against this ancient beast - starvation had left the Nothari weak in their inherent magic. But your father nontheless endeavored to face the dragon alone, while he ordered you to march with the remaining Nothari to safer lands.
Rule of your people falls to you, and there is no time for guilt or regret.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Orrigor was transformed by the vengeful sprit of the volcano, Orrimoros. None have witnessed any burns upon his body, but it is said that he lives with the constant pain of one burned head to toe. Regardless of the truth of his past, he is now a mighty manipulator of flame and powerful channeler.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
The Raktar prized the ability to channel fire above all other disciplines. You could barely channel air, and you were called 'Azmir' - failure. It always seemed to you that your people saw a mask upon you, a worthless, unloved face.
But then you made the climb to Orrimoros, the volcano. Where you changed.
Upon your return, fire flowed fluently from your fingers. Much burned that day, and they now call you 'Orrigor' - their leader. Perhaps when the Raktur have burned away the chaos that infects Elemental, they shall see your true character beneath this new mask of power.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Dagond is a mighty warrior, and a keen woodsman. He is ever concerned with the movements of beasts, men, and Fallen upon his borders, and his outposts keep a vigilant watch. It is said that he once killed an Ogre alone, without a weapon. Those who seek to meet him in combat would do well to bring overwhelming might against him.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Your father, you never knew - he died fighting trolls. Your mother, she died before your eyes, in a raid by the darkling shaman Vurhakshil.
Hate for the twisted creatures drove you on. When you reached the age of maturity, you hunted Vurhakshil. When you returned with its head and called to the watchers atop their outposts, a feast was called. The women jealously vied for your gaze. Shortly afterwards, you began to exhibit the abilities of a channeler.
War and violence is existence itself. But a warrior balances death with life. Under your rule, the Dremorian Nation shall hunt the savage twisted. The Fallen too - even savage men - shall discipline their inner savagery, or die.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: An eccentric man, that barely speaks beyond mumbles, Raesurloss is easily confused for a mad old man. Yet those who tend to him know that in his ramblings there is great wisdom, and none can match his leadership. Nature itself bows to his command, and those who underestimate him as a mad old fool may find themselves dead below the boughs of old trees, while the old leaves laugh silently.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You do not tell of your age. Your people do not know that you walked among the great forests that grew only before the cataclysm. They know you are wise, but not that you received some of that wisdom from Morian the Tree Lord himself, before his madness made him Ruin Of Summer.
Most of all you do not share the prophecy which troubles you. That the creatures of Elemental itself would kill the trees, in turn ending all life upon the world.
The cataclysm was brought by the Titans, it culled nearly all the trees, it made Morian mad. But this was not the prophecy come true. You believe this is the time when the prophesy shall be decided, and you shall not abandon those few trees that still grow. Even if great death must be wrought to save them, with a heavy heart you shall make it so.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Togeran is no warrior. Many have estimated this as weakness, as lost their lives. He is a scholar and a tinker, but one knows the place of battle in the machinery of the world. He uses his insights into chemistry, mechanics, and composition to equip his warriors and deploy his armies effectively. Only might combined with wisdom can be relied upon to stop his reign.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
It was your recipe for firebombs that saved the people from butchermen. Your stories of old wonders gave them hope. And your belief that those wonders could be reclaimed in their life times, made them appoint you Sovereign.
You have no interest in war but you do know how to teach. You inculcate a love of analysis in your people, ignite in them the passion of tinkering, mixing, disassembling. And you have already seen this attitude manifest itself in ideas you could not have made on your own.
Otaran shall unlock the lost secrets of the Magi, and return peace to Elemental by virtue of the power of mind. For this, you are willing to fight the savages.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: A proud, gregarious man, with keen charm and a frugal eye for making a profit. Alas for his enemies, he knows the mighty financial returns that war can bring. Carzemir seeks to build a strong, wealthy society that can afford massive legions, and when he does this he will not hesitate to spread his vision of the world to every corner of Elemental.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You saw once an old book, and in it were drawings of merchant cities, adorned with sculpture, flowering around its fountains and piazzas.
Under your rule, this civilization shall return through trade, design, and science. Merchant houses can grow strong again, schools can be raised to teach mathematics. Over time, trade with men and fallen alike shall give you power no weapon can match.
You shall one day look over clean, cobbled streets, and hear minstrel girls singing softly while you sip lush wine. Even if you must march into Fallen lands and burn their cities for this to become real, then so be it. Shall not the wine taste all the sweeter, then?

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Zychera is seen as the fairest of all her people, though other races tend to see her differently. Those who treat with her would be wise to indulge her self-assessment of beauty, lest they wish for war with Zychera, queen of magics.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You are called beautiful, now, and a master of the arcane. But you were deformed, once. Your magic impotent. They insulted you, beat your for your inexperienced mistakes. You ran away, wandering the wastes. As you starved, the shadowy stranger came to you. He gifted you with magic, and a face that would be seen as fair to your cruel people's eyes. He asked only that you someday repay his favor.
When you returned, you quickly rose in rank among the people, taking vengeance on each of your former oppressors. Now any who challenge you are destroyed - just as the stranger shall be, if he dares attempt to collect on your debt.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Even a Trog would feel fear, if he saw Bhargol Thuhl charging at him with an axe. Bhargol is huge, his frame corded with strong muscle and armored by a thick hide. His horns and teeth are nearly as effective as a sword in his tense grip. The Thuhl beastmen are savage and chaotic, but under Bhargol's leadership they have become a terrible horde that could overwhelm any fortification.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
As a young warrior, you were enslaved by Quendar, made a dog to them. There, you saw the Quendar kill Thuhl, and Trogs. Not by might, but by numbers. Then you escaped, and ate those who called themselves master. You took their strength and ideas for your own. Magic, too, was growing inside you, awakened by their presence.
Thus have you forced the pups of Thuhl packs to lay with the pups of old rivals. Old packs shall be forgotten, the Thuhl shall become a united race. Your One-Pack shall grow by feasting on the spoils of fighting sent outward. Quendar, Trogs, Men, all shall snap and die under your clubs.
Those Thuhl that cannot see this great vision, they shall be devoured to make your vision all the stronger.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Hol-Drasu is a master of deception, attacking unseen or hiding his strengths until his enemies reveal their weaknesses. His knowledge of anatomy, men and Fallen alike, makes him a lethal killer. Deadliest of all, however, is his patience. Like a spider he can wait, still and calm, until his prey at last falters and becomes prone. Then he strikes with supernatural speed, ensuring final and complete victory over his foes.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Your mother wanted more for you. The Sholdari, she believed, could not see beyond death. After a terrible defeat against a raiding tribe of men, she believed the power of life was too great. She fled with you, and your two brothers, to seek a new life elsewhere.
One brother soon starved. The other was slaughtered by hergon. Your mother told stories of a great new empire you would lead, mastering life magic. She called you a Sorcerer prince.
These were beautiful ideas. But you would not starve in the wastes. Life served death, that was her crucial mistake. She filled your stomach one last time, and you returned to lead the Sholdari.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Rarely does Rastmore engage in diplomacy. Some diplomats and merchants tell stories of his chaotic temperment. One insists he is in fact more than one mind, battling for dominance at all times, making deals one minute then cancelling them in the next. But he is no mere madman, for despite his ravings and fickle decisions he commands great power and wisdom, and his Drednii cults bring forth demons to serve in his armies.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
When you speak, the humans hear their language. Measured, fluent, assuring. But that is not your thoughts...they are chaotic, brilliant, beautiful...
...the passage is key. You can control it, make the others come through to help. Ongrzzyx must be freed, soon. But first, he must gain passage. The Drednii can be purer in form, fight the dischordant flesh things that infect Elemental. When they are gone, Ongrzzyx can-
- do not want to do this - !
Silence! You shall be silent.
Rastmore shall sleep. You are Ongrzzyx now. When Elemental is ours, Ongrzzyx can leave this flesh prison, and all shall be beautiful shadow and death...

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: No smith has ever walked Elemental that could show greater skill. Gaalskuul has made legendary swords from scraps of stone, and impenetrable shields from sand and dying tree limbs. He does this by virtue of the firestone forge, a strange magical forge of his invention. However it came to be, forges of his design are the nexus of his growing military empire. Legions of Fallen, Ogres, and darklings will soon send forth from his lands, equipped with the fruit of his forges.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Your first firestone forge was not the largest, but you made it work the hardest of any that came after. Warriors of your kind heard of its mighty works, and came to kill or enslave you. The fruits of your forge slew them easily.
Then, you gave out small pieces of armor to those who pledged loyalty. They survived in battle, and soon many wanted to pledge loyalty. You never gave out your best works, but empowered all who swore to you with a small gift of the forge.
Chieftains who served you wore your firestone circlets. Even the twisted creatures of the wild came to you, offering fealty. Your forge and its strength shall kill or subjugate this whole world.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Ritheria is a beautiful woman, and a trusted statesman. Her people are loyal, and those countries that ally with her will have only peace in their futures. That is what many come to think, at least, after just one meeting with Ritheria. But those who have watched from afar know differently. Any sovereign who would remain independant would be wise to look deeper, below Ritheria's beauty, to the cunning serpent beneath.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You learned everything you know from the last queen of your people, Verdemes. You were her handmaiden, and she recognized your potential. You watcher her, and learned to manipulate enemies and friends alike. Alas, that she missed your hidden growing magic, and your slow isolation of her. In the end, you cried as you stabbed her yourself, and she only realized your betrayal in that moment.
You shall live up to her admiration of you. All shall admire your beauty, and submit to your rule. Or, they shall wither and die from your venom.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Even Urner can no longer count how many villages he has raided, men he has cleaved, women he has taken, children enslaved. With an axe in hand, few mortals can withstand his attacks. He has eaten Trog hearts, and developed a taste for them. Most dangerous of all, however, are the Gaush barbarians united under him. Urner is now learning tactics, and infantry deployment. With Urner at the head of Gaushon legions, Men and Fallen nations alike have reason to fear.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Your son, you named Brujnkal. He loved you, and you him. He pillaged beside you.
He took a group of men to raid Amarians, while you crushed a group of Gaush that thought to start their own tribe, in disrespect of you. They died easily, and you spat on their bodies.
But then you returned home to see Brujnkal sitting upon your throne, and calling your wife his own. His warriors stood ready to kill you. You fought, tears in your eyes, and nearly died from the wounds. But in the end you broke the spine of your own son.
The Guash must be united, that no more sons need be slain. Let the other nations scream and bleed under your axes.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
-5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To seek adventure despite danger is the highest virtue.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I am no idealist, Sovereign. I have bled. Killed. I have seen an axe blade only narrowly miss the cleaving of my skull. I crave adventure not because I am nave and sheltered, as some do. I crave it because I have learned well how fragile and precious life is. Even for you, channeler, who lives so long, time is not unlimited. Let us make the most of this time together, standing against evil and dangers for glorious reward.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The snapping of a bowstring is music to me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
A better bow, and wages in gold. That is all I need from you, dear sovereign. Give me wages, and the chance to find or craft a superior bow, and I shall patrol the woods for you. I shall see your enemies, delay them, kill them.
I have stated my needs.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The faith of the people is a sweet nectar. Let us gorge upon it together.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
The people sometimes speak of freedom. This is when they are most childish.
Freedom leads them to forget necessity. Even food and safety, they will carelessly lose when pondering fantastic possibilities of liberty. This we must control.
We shall control them together. And for this, we shall be rewarded with their faith, and thusly we inherit the collected sum of their power.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Truth is like the wind. The breeze is heard for only a moment - if we are patient and listen, we can hear it.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
The people long for truth, even as they long for distractions and comforting lies. I believe we must give them both.
The world is harsh for them, the labor they must endure is taxing. Fantasy and comforting ideas nourish and renew them. Are we to starve our labor, our bedrock? No.
And yet the truth must be hidden within the stories we tell them. Sweet and salted bread smothered over tasteless yet nourishing meat.
At brief moments, they shall feel a need for truth, ideas beyond the day's labor. We must give them just enough so that they do not begin to question the sweet bread.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'War is not muscle's reign. Battle belongs to he who sees and plans, then gently guides its flow.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
Trogs, my sovereign. They think ferocity and aggressiveness wins battles. Why then, after all these centuries, have they not dominated the whole world, then?
When I am in your service, I shall show you. I shall know your enemy best when they march against you. In those moments I shall share their strengths and weaknesses with you. And then we shall devise the tactics that slay them, and our families shall-
Forgive me. Your citizens shall be safe, and your rule long. I take my leave.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Your enemies will call me Pashvaug, the terror in the shadows.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
You wish to know of me? I am only happy when I am hunting. Give me quarries, and they shall die. I shall be happy with this, and your interests served.
I bid you good night.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Fickle like the tide, perhaps. I am ever flowing. I adapt to everything.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
In prayers, I sense the changing world. One day, yes, murder is wrong. Illegal for the common folk. The next we may need to change this rule, and thus it shall change.
The people must understand this, and have faith. In prayer, I am much wiser than they, who are born to work, not to question or think themselves.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Ha ha ha! Oh. Heh. Forgive me, sovereign. I saw our future. It was glory, and laughter!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
Some have said I am mad, best left to prayer in the cloister. They may be correct!
Ha! Ha. I do not know why you make me so merry. There is something joyous about our cooperation.
Yes, yes, I am rambling. Let me pray, and be in touch with the people's faith. I shall make your kingdom stronger. More faithful!
(snicker) I just think of the glories, the monuments we might raise, and I giggle...
Oh, you must go? I hope I did not offend...yes, good day.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am the calling thunder. Name your enemies, that is enough. I shall hunt them.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
In the woods at night, Sovereign, that is when stories are told. Spun by the breeze between trunks and leaves. It rises on the chattering insects - tingles the skin with the passing of a wolf, too close. It crescendos when the stars appear above, and their hidden voices speak to my ears alone.
Listening to these stories, truths are borne. The truth of battle. The weaknesses of beasts, of the twisted creatures in the wastes. Many other things, too. Mere words cannot express what I have learned. But my weapon can tell you, in a fight.
I am sure you will know, soon, for many battles are coming, are they not?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: (Mauhagr does not speak, but his eyes show a fierce intelligence)

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let us cut through the unfaithful, purge the impure. Ours shall be a great Empire of Faith.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
I shall tend the flock, dear sovereign. Their silly errant ideas shall be disciplined. Their potential shall blossom through faith and adherence, oh yes it will.
Their beauties shall pleasure us, their industry strengthen us.
Let us cradle them closely. And if they disrespect us, harshly correct them.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I do not like the title, Glorious. Vanity! But they do not abandon it, when I request such.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
Do not let me take up your time, Lord. It is my place to keep the chapel clean, and complete my prayer duties.
Also, I must distribute tithes as is necessary. And the delivery boys must not take bread from the alms basket! And the back steps, they must be swept as well. Even swept hourly, dust gathers anew on them.
At day's end, the people gather for me to listen to their troubles. So many come for guidance. They insist on seeing me, not the other priests. This demands much of my schedule.
Do you see how simple my life is? I find it vexing that I am called 'Glorious.' It is vanity!
The people make little sense to me, often. But the truth is that I do love them, even their boils and wrinkled skin. Inside, they are beautiful.
Excuse me, Lord. I must check on the delivery boys, they do crave that alms bread. And I am sure the back steps are dusty once more...

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The earth below us is tense with worry. I can translate it's concerns.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
The trees are the face of the land below. Beautiful and meaningful, but the deeper truth is in the rivers, and even further down, the leagues of rock and soil under us.
The land listens, it has heard so much and for so long. The dragons. The channellers, the Forge, the Titans. Then cataclysm. That was the ultimate horror, and our mother nearly gave up hope in the face of it.
Now, it has passed. We can all recover and grow. But the death magic seeks to return. The Titans are not totally gone, the tiniest seed of their evil strives to re-grow.
The Earth mother asks that you kill this seed, Channeler. And I am happy to lend my bow to that cause.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Xim Hachailis Velonmor. Say those words to the trees, and they shall tremble, remembering me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
I am a killer. I am willing to kill your enemies. The trees have silently witnessed this.
I know magic. Chaotic flows of water, silent ripples of shadow. The creatures of the forest know, and would tell if you trapped them.
I am swift. The wolves attest to this in their songs under moon.
The shadows reward silence, and a sea is calm until the storm. What else to speak of?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'No mass rouses the faith of the people better than a gallows mass, where a manling is tortured then hung.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
I have seen the future. The people's faith is now strong, but it will grow much stronger. So strong your Empire shall never falter.
To achieve this we must burn. The kingdom cities must be razed in fire, each and every one. We shall bring the people to bask in the glow of the flames. They shall chant your name, and in this moment you shall be their beloved parent. In their hearts and songs forever.
Let us pray, and then plan the battles. The future of your Empire calls.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The clanging of spear upon shield is the most meaningful of sacraments.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
War is an atrocity. I know this because I have made it, done it. Only through faith can I continue on.
Yet war can improve the world. Victory can strengthen faith, and forge a world where war is no longer necessary.
I am no innocent, and I believe a time will come when I answer for my crimes, when the Destiny will weigh my rights over my wrongs, and vindicate me.
Or perhaps I will be condemned, and punished. Ardanyon shall not whine or beg in the face of divine retribution. For my oath to better the world shall have been kept, even if I am damned for it.
